choices: *flashback* to how you know the girl
Write the beginning of the book.
Write a chapter for the middle of the book.
1.content:
I had her on the ground tied up and bleeding all over. Every time she tried to cry out, every time she shed a tear I kicked her in the gut. Maybe their are other ways to let out anger like counting to ten. Count the ten scars on my arms, the ten times I cry a day because of what she did to me.
She looked up to me with soulless eyes, the eyes of a liar, the eyes of a madwoman, the eyes of a lover. Someone was outside, snooping around trying to find and kill me for what I've done. After all I've done, when I get to Heaven me and God will have a nice long chat. Whoever it is outside, their taking to long to kill me, to end my life, to free my soul.
"I loved her!" I screamed out.
Next.
1.title: The start of the end.

11.content:
"You did good, Lidon. Very good. I'm sure she knows your pain, Lidon...

She knows your pain..."

I assumed it was retribution. The devil which had worked his magic over me, pulled the wool over my eyes, would now draw the noose over my neck and kick out my stool for me. Stooped over the bloodied vixen, I barely gave notice to Ellis slipping the long rope cord over me. He'd come prepared; a little quaint chair ready and waiting for me. Just like I imagined...

"Thank you, Ellis..."

My guardian angel, my murderer. The vixen was no more, because of him. My entire life, no more, because of him. And soon, what remained of it would disappear from this earth entirely, me, all because of him. I wanted to hug him, that snide, cruel demon. Due to him, I kissed the fires of revenge and danced with the follies of death!

How funny, that the she-devil and I should both die in ropes...

But mine wouldn't stay!!! It snapped! I tumbled to the ground, smashing my ribs, my legs!! But still in crippled, horrifying life! I snapped my head to look at my guardian, who had only cut the rope down! Why? Didn't he just want me to disappear, too?

The lights flared up again, definitely not the inviting lights of the hell I seeked. Why? Why??

The entire idea had been his... It had always been his...

HIS
11.title: Free Me

choices: Hi officers, I heard all this screaming and found this young man beating this
When I woke up, I was tied up again.
111.content:
He put the large flashlight into my eyes and all I could see was his silhouette.
"Why, what have I done to you to make me do this?" I asked him.
"It's because I hate you so very much Liddon," that's why, he answered.
"Tell me, I said, was this set up from the very beginning? Meeting her and all of that?"
"It sure was, the the very first time she made sure you ran into her, she knew it would get your attention. I have paid her well, even if she had to bear your anger and take her punishment."
I looked over at the girl I once knew, lying in her own vomit, hair matted with it. NIkki, the girl I fell in love with, turned on me like a mad dog. And why would she do this, what had I done to her?

"Oh, it isn't about her at all, Lidon said. It's all about you and what you did to my sister. Remember, the girl you were dating and you left her, said 'you had to have time to figure out what you wanted to do.' "
"Yeah, but what has this got to do with me dating Nikki?"
"When you never called my sister back, she began to cry and she cried for a long time. Then she quit going to work, she quit dressing up or taking baths until finally one day she took a bath alright, she got into a full tub of water, had a glass of wine and slit her wrist. By the time I got home and went to check on her, she was dead. All because of you."

"Wait, it wasn't my fault she killed herself, or became depressed. She was fine when we separated. You can't blame this on me. It could have been someone else after I left."

"Nope, you see, she left me a note and told me all about you and how you left her high and dry. They anger I have carried for so long developed into this little play on you. The cops are on their way and when they see how you have beaten up this young lady, you will burn in jail for a long time. Actually, if she were dead it would even be worse for you, don't you think?"

"No! Don't kill her."

Lidon walks over and strangles Nikki, then walks back over to him. He knocks him out just as the police arrive.
111.title: Lights blaring in my face...

choices: Holding the girl's hand, back when she was still alive.
With Ellis, learning of my mission in this world.
112.content:
The light died down, a little bit at a time until I was able to see again. I looked around and the first thing I noticed was that I was outside in the forest. The trees were like skyscrapers all around me. Skyscrapers covered in light green leaves and moss. The second thing I noticed was the thing lying in front of me. I looked down at it, barely able to figure out what this thing is. It took some time before I finally realized, this is her body.
This girl which caused me months of searching and days of planning to find. This girl who was the reason I was activated in the first place, well at least one of the reasons. The other two reasons were still out their walking the Earth and I knew then and there that I must find and kill them both to set things right. This girl was only the beginning, the beginning of my own personal Hell.
I tried getting up but then I realized both my legs were broken. "Damn that prankster, Ellis!" I shouted. He pretended to put me out of my misery, he pretended to kill me. Only to drop me down from death and impede my mobility in the process. I tried getting up again. Extreme pain flared up my legs and shot through my entire body, I screamed in agony and gritted my teeth. Something laughed in the distance. It wasn't Ellis, it was a new voice.
"Is the little baby going to cry?" It asked. The laughter started getting louder as it neared. I knew at once what was coming. It was a spirit and judging by it's voice it didn't sound like a very nice spirit.
"Begone evil spirit! Let me tend to my own wounds" I yelled out into the open. The air around me started getting thicker, the spirit was right above me. Though it's body was transparent I felt it's presence all around me. It started laughing again.
"Why, young child. I just want to help you on your way." The spirit laughed again. I felt an incredible weight on my shoulder and the air was so thick I could hardly breathe. "Now child, breathe deep and I will show you your worst nightmares."
Soon my eyes closed and I passed out. When I awoke I was....
112.title: Agonizing, still alive...

113.content:
Sheer, limitless terror, immense speed, gloom, and the despairing howls and groans of other souls. Those were the first sensations. It was like being in a dream, likely of the nightmare persausion. The dark tunnel walls became less sollid as I sped on through the cold air like a rag in a hurricane wind, eventually dissolving entirly into a frigid, black mist. I guesssed I was still moving, but the fog was too thick too distinguish anything to judge my spee din relation to. I was terrified-it actually felt good, to be scared again. Perhaps it meant I had accquired something to lose. A red glow shawn through the fog from below, and my anxiety grew. Suddenly, I broke through the clouds.

Judging by the lanscape below, I had succesfully died and gone to the eternal reward for my actions.

         Other quasi-corporeal figures-souls, I assumed- streamed down beside me, their expressions locked in rictuses of despair and horror to equal mine. Below, the sources of the glow became apparent. Huge foundries that looked like full-sized volcanoes shook and roared by the dozen across the ladnscape. Lava and molten metal poured from the peaks, hissing and shrieking like my fellow damned as it met up with the lakes of boiling blood and acid that pocked the hell-scape. In between, on, and over these someone had taken the liberty to build a vast city, extending to beyond the infinite horizon. The architecture varied; in some areas, skyscrappers of exotic bone leaned haphazardly, bordered chaotically by ghettos of still-cooling magma and palaces of infernal iron. A gargantuan, obsidian tower that exuded horror loomed in the far distance. The heat haze, smoke and fumes, and the very questionable physics of this dimension made its size and distance away hard to judge, though. I was falling towards a complex ringed with warehouses, several deep pits in the middle of which already throthed with a sea of screaming souls. Occaionally, one of the large, hideous figures dancing around them would reach down, skewer one with a long hooked pike, and drag it shreiking up and away.
         I jerked to as stop, agony paralyzing me. It radiated out from my right shoulder, and I weakly turned my head to regard the bat-winged thing that had impaled me with several of its claws. "Master's to see you now." It hissed nassily, flapping off towards the tower, dragging me along. I might have passed out or something, because suddenly I was kneeling in a massive hall. Gigantic pillars hundreds of feet high rose into the darkness on either side, extending in rows beyond my vision. As I noticed the curious way in which they met and joined with the floor, I realized that they must have been hewn out of some impossibly vast diamond or other gemstone, inlayed with enough gold to recreate a large city using nothing but the valuable metal. But the array of finely dressed, pwerful fiends all about me, or the innumberable other wonders situated around the chamber, couldn't begin to hold my attention in comparison to the titanic figure seated on a throne before me. The physical, tangible feeling of raw power he gave off drove me into the floor. I couldn' t begin to describe what he-she-it, looked like, except that it perfectly summised my greatest terrors and most intense bestial desires-including one's I had never befor experienced. I felt keenly the satisfaction of gluttony, the delight in knowing my works were better than anyone else's crafts and boasting openly about that fact, and the feeling of power that came from commiting a cold blooded murder, to name but a few. Rage, lust, envy, hunger, pride, fear, and hate all couresd through me as I lay there. I knew that I must be looking at the lord of Hell himself.

You are arrogent and foolish, worm. Boomed a voice within my mind, alomst shattering it instantly with its' raw power. I am far beneathe such mighty powers; but a proxy, ordered to personally return you to conduct your Lord's bidding. You will return, to spread sin, but also to have your vengeance on the many who have wronged you. Perform well, and you may not be justly punished upon your return here. Now...go.{/font

I was blasted from the hall, mind barely safe from overwhelming chaos left in the aftermath of the monsters tellepathic voice, and awoke on the floor beside the body of the young women I had murdered. Pain suffused me. I coughed, and blood poured out my mouth and down my throat. Ellis stood over me, the butcher holding his trademark jagged knife. "The authorities are closing in. I will mis you, Lidon. You were a useful pawn for a time, just like that girl there." He gestured to the still form, and a wicked possibilty blossomed in my still-worn mind. "Ah, good, my stupid friend. You see exactly what I did to enlist your services. After all, someone needed to scar that handsome face of yours. Someone needded to ensure you realized your full potential. This girl presented herself, with a dear old father who's failing, expensively maintained health she would have done anything to preserve-and so I 'convinced' her to asist me in this endeavor. I convinced your family, your friends, your lady, that you were a monster. I saw too it they were all horribly tortured and killed, before your helpless eyes, and that you were framed for the crime. Then I approached you, pretending to be somone else wounded by this monstrous creature,this fox, and goaded you off the path of just walking away and restarting your life, and onto seeking vengeance. So, really, Lidon, I'm the one you should be mad at. She was just a tool- I choreographed your unlocking your own abilities. It is too bad that you became obsessed with dying, and asked me to asist you in your suicide as your friend. We could have gone so far togethor. But now...The police will catch you. You will be sentenced, and then executed for treason, conspiracy, murder, man-slaughter, rape, arson, and much more than a few other delightful crimes. Well, I'll see you in hell-in a few millainea. In the meantime..." He brandished a small machine part, a cylinder and pump with several other pieces attached. "I have what I came for. The murder of a tortured innocent in the nearby vicinity even gave it some starting fuel too! Yes, you were quite usefull, would have made a valuable minion." Sirens sounded in the distance. "So long, sucka'!" He smirked, and strode out, while I still breathed shallowly on the floor. The pain in my legs and chest was excruciating, I guessed I had broken several ribbs, at least one of which had punctured my lungs. How was I still alive? I din't want o bee-the pian nedded to stop at any cost!
          I felt something moving in my leg, and looked down. My pant leg bulged and spasmed gruesomely, and I grunted as something snapped back into place within, unable to muster the strength to scream out. I breathed deeper, and realized the stabbing pains in my torso were fading. Seconds later, I could stand, and staggered over to the bench holding an array of knives and other weapons. I picked up only one- the same one I had stabbed the vixen with. She had been forced to torment me, to kill my family and all I cared about, to destroy the ex-me.
         Unconsciously, I looked at her face. Earlier, her eyes had been filled with pleading for life and a terrible remorse I hadn't fully understood at the time. Now, they just stared blankly ahead. Her entire body was relaxed, peacefull. Wherever her soul was bound, I doubted it was the hell-scape I would someday see again. That was immaterial, unimportant. I cleaned the knife-on my sleave,not the corpse- and looked in the direction taken by the departed Ellis. My own life, my own soul, was not important. All that mattered was that demon-that he suffered. He was going to hell for a long, long time, if only when I dragged him to the lowest pits along with me.
113.title: To Hell and back... ...To hell on Earth.

12.content:
Next the police burst in wielding several large batons the size of your waist, "What have you done with this girl," they demanded, "Herald Gutenberg, you are under arrest for the impersonation and forgery in which this girl was subjected to."
I hung my head downwards, and scowling I reached for the nearest object... My fingers grasped around a broken glass bottle and I hurled it at them in anger and reconciliation.

'You. Shall. Forgive me,' I stated to the madwoman, "For I do not deserve this fate," I spoke with bated breath. Immediately.
12.title: The police burst in.

choices: Does he meet the police on the way out, just bearly getting away?
123.content:
Not only the room but the ground shakes violently, they could hear screams for miles, one of the police steps to steady himself and falls threw the floor.
The second runs down the stairs to help his partner.
As the shaking stops Herald scowls angrily at the situation and packs a suitcase realizing he can no longer stay there.
123.title: The room shakes

choices: Temptation Takes Over And You Un-Tie Her
13.content:
You kick the girl in the gut as you scream out abusive comments.

Suddenly, flashbacks come.

"Hi. I'm Nikki!" The young woman said. She had light red hair, and it was very curly. For a moment we were lost in each other.

When we finally broke out of the snap, I looked down and saw her sandwiches on the floor. Then I remembered that you bumped into her because you were texting.

"Oh, man! That's my lunch gone!" She sighed and bends down. Her cucumber cobs were in a pile on the concrete.

"Sorry, I didn't mean it!" I said and bent down with her.

"Come on, we're late!" My girlfriend sat beside me and introduced herself to Nikki.

"I loved her! I loved her and you ruined us!" You scream and punch her.
13.title: FlashBacks

choices: Let's View A Chapter In Her Perspective
What Is She Dreaming About Right Now?
132.content:
You grin at her as you reach into your back pocket. Your friends (back when you had friends, she made them all go away!) said that your grin always reminded them of a serial killers grin. The grin of Charles Manson, the grin of Jack the Ripper. You pull the knife from your pocket, holding the sharp side incredibly tight in your fist. Who cares if you bleed here. Whatever amount of blood you lose here, she's going to lose twice that, maybe even all of it if all goes according to plan.
You twirl the knife in your hand, so that the blade is pointing up, and get on your knee's in front of her. You start laughing out loud as you grip her left arm with your left hand and move your right hand, holding the knife, towards her skin.
"How many cuts do you think I should make?" You ask her in a very cynical way. She screams something but ever since you bond and gagged her all she's been saying all day is muffled gibberish. Very well, you'll just cut until she loses feeling in her arm.
You stab the knife deep into her arm, she screams a muffled yell and moves her head back. She tries to wiggle away from you but she can't, she's trapped remember? You stab the knife deeper into her arm until the blade is pointing out of the other side a little. Blood is practically pouring to the floor and you actually start to worry that perhaps you went to far. Your worries are confirmed when she falls backwards with her eyes closed, not moving at all. Fortunately though, you notice she is still breathing, she only passed out from shock. Well... shock and blood loss.
You got up from the ground and started to cry a little. You reached down and dipped your index finger into the pool of blood surrounding this girl now. You get up when your whole hand is practically bathed in the stuff and walk to the wall behind your victim. There you write in her blood.
11/8/08
132.title: You Get A Knife

choices: Immediately pull away and stab her
133.content:
You chuckle as you turn around from the bloody wall and stare at her. She's still on the floor, deep red blood pulsing from her body each second. Her curly red hair is stained and spread everywhere, her turquoise eyes are flickering, the gleam gone. She lay there, motionless in her brown denim skirt; purple top and pumps.
         Believing your work is done, you turn to go to the door. But as soon as your bloody hand touches the doorknob, you hear a cough. You swivel round; she's alive! No!
 "How did you survive, you cow?" you screech, secretly amazed. The girl tries to struggle against the ropes, but she's lost too much blood. "Stop squirming or I'll finish you for good!" She freezes.
  "I - know - you - still - love - me!" she coughs, her voice barely audible. "Admit - it!"
         You growl under your breath. You explode with anger inside.
You gently kneel on the ground and crawl up to her, your face red and burning. She looks up at you with tear-filled eyes as if she's desperate for her life. You edge closer until your face is only about a foot apart from hers. You duck your head to her ear and whisper. "Never."
         You bring your face back up to her's, only inches apart. You look at her beautiful face and all the damage that you've done to it. She tries to sit up but the ropes are too tight. You hold the ropes still; and she stops squirming.
         Suddenly, something draws your head to her's. You try to look up to see if someone is pushing your head down, but no one is there. Your face edges closer and closer to her's until you're only centimetres apart. Your head turns to the right whilst her's turns to the left; and you press your lips against hers.
133.title: Unexpected

choices: A simple family on a farm.
An upper-class family in the city.
An average family in the suburbs.
A department store in the center of town.
14.content: Where does this concerning story even begin?
14.title: Endings are beginnings waiting to happen, afterall

choices: The last royal family in a country that no longer supports royals.
The far future, where society now exists in space.
145.content: So... How does this tale even begin?
145.title: Other story start points.

choices: Go back to the first kiss.
Go to the chapter where they met.
Go to the chapter of the climax.
15.content:
"Wasn't that fun?" Linsey said?

We were in my VW Bug, driving to our house from the movies.

"I didn't saw that ending coming," I responded, "I wouldn't had thought it up any time."

"And yet you like suspence movies." Linsey threw back her blond hair. She was dazzeling that night. I couldn't believe that we only met a week ago and we were going out.

"Bye the way," she asked, "How about we go to the local bar tomarrow?"

"That's a great idea!" I laughed and pulled over. We exited the car. Once we were at the porch I searched my coat pockets for the key to the door. But Linsey just picked it out of my left back pocket. She giddled as she clinged them.

"Give them back." I happily commanded.

"Have it your way." When she dropped the keys into my hand, she drew closer. And then we locked lips, and we had our second kiss.
15.title: Chapter 5

info.brief_description: Why can't a book have multiple endings?
info.description: So I'm trying to make book right now on my spare time. I wrote most of the outline down and what not but I got stuck at the ending. I came up with several endings for the book I'm writing so that got me thinking. Why can't books have multiple endings? This story you can add on an extra chapter adding to the plot or end it right then and there. I'm cool with everything but please make each chapter at least two paragraphs long.
